title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, $$\frac{2}{5}$$, and $$\frac{-3}{4}$$?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: We must now multiply both sides of the equation by the LCD to get rid of the fractions. We now have $$6\times20=\operatorname{20}\left(\frac{1}{2} v\right)+\operatorname{20}\left(\frac{2}{5} v\right)-\operatorname{20}\left(\frac{3}{4} v\right)$$. This simplifies to $$120=3v$$

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve this equation for v, we must first isolate the \"v\" term in the equation.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: We can isolate v by dividing both sides of the equation by 3. What is the value of v?
